options.label: D
options.text: Participants showed no interest in distributing resources.

options.text: Similar personality traits

options.label: D
options.text: Geographic location

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

title: These companies with no CEO are thriving

options.label: A
options.text: It has a CEO who makes all major decisions.

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: It has a president who is elected by the members.

options.label: D
options.text: It has a board of directors who make all major decisions.

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary mission of a cooperative (co-op)?

options.label: A
options.text: To maximize profit for shareholders.

options.label: B
options.text: To serve the interests of its members.

options.label: C
options.text: To compete with traditional businesses.

options.label: D
options.text: To provide jobs to people in the community.

multiple-choice.question: How do co-ops typically make decisions?

options.label: A
options.text: Through a top-down approach, where the CEO makes all major decisions.

options.label: B
options.text: Through a democratic process, where members vote on major decisions.

options.label: C
options.text: Through a consensus-based approach, where all members must agree on a decision.

options.label: D
options.text: Through a random selection process, where decisions are made by chance.

multiple-choice.question: What is the difference in voting rights between a traditional company and a co-op?

options.label: A
options.text: In a traditional company, every shareholder has one vote, while in a co-op, voting rights are based on the number of shares owned.

options.label: B
options.text: In a traditional company, voting rights are based on the number of shares owned, while in a co-op, every member has one vote.

options.label: C
options.text: In a traditional company, only the CEO has voting rights, while in a co-op, all members have voting rights.

options.label: D
options.text: In a traditional company, voting rights are not allowed, while in a co-op, voting rights are mandatory.

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: Co-op workers are about 40% happier with their jobs.

options.label: D
options.text: Co-op workers have more opportunities for advancement.

title: The Boltzmann brain paradox - Fabio Pacucci

multiple-choice.question: What is the main claim to fame of Ludwig Boltzmann, a 19th-century physicist?

options.label: A
options.text: Revolutionizing quantum mechanics

options.label: B
options.text: Revolutionizing thermodynamics

options.label: C
options.text: Revolutionizing cosmology

options.label: D
options.text: Revolutionizing relativity

multiple-choice.question: According to the second law of thermodynamics, what is the tendency of closed systems?

options.label: A
options.text: Towards order

options.label: B
options.text: Towards disorder

options.label: C
options.text: Towards stability

options.label: D
options.text: Towards chaos

multiple-choice.question: What is the Boltzmann brain paradox?

options.label: A
options.text: The idea that the universe has existed for an infinite time

options.label: B
options.text: The idea that the universe had a beginning

options.label: C
options.text: The idea that it is more likely for a brain to form randomly than for the universe to exist as it does

options.label: D
options.text: The idea that the universe is infinite in size

multiple-choice.question: What is the resolution to the Boltzmann brain paradox?

options.label: A
options.text: That the universe has existed forever

options.label: B
options.text: That the universe had a beginning, specifically the Big Bang

options.label: C
options.text: That the universe is infinite in size

options.label: D
options.text: That the universe is in a state of constant flux

multiple-choice.question: Why has the Boltzmann brain paradox found renewed interest among contemporary cosmologists?

options.label: A
options.text: Because it has been proven to be true

options.label: B
options.text: Because it has been proven to be false

options.label: C
options.text: Because leading models for the origin of the universe still imply that Boltzmann brains are more likely than human brains

options.label: D
options.text: Because it is no longer relevant to modern cosmology
